The Moorside took the country by storm when it aired on the BBC earlier this month. 
The two-parter was aired across two weeks, and pulled in a huge audience as viewers tuned in to see the retelling of Shannon Matthews' fake kidnap at the hands of her mother Karen. 
Now, a strange recreation of the show has made its way onto social media and been shared over one million times on Facebook. 
The bizarre clip shows three friends playing the roles of Karen, Karen’s best pal Julie and Karen’s disgraced partner, Craig. The clip has been watched over a million times (Photo: Jess Wall/Facebook) The Moorside aired earlier this month (Photo: Jess Wall/Facebook) 
It was shares shortly after the drama aired on TV, alongside the caption: “Normal Saturday night recreating Moorside,” 
In the clip, which has now been watched 1.4 million times, the friends re-enact the moment Julie confronts Karen and asks her if she knew where Shannon was all along. The recreation has sent social media into meltdown (Photo: Jess Wall/Facebook) 
It comes to an end with Karen and Craig pleading for the safe return of their little one, while another friend laughs off-screen. 
The video was uploaded by Jess Wall, who also shared images of her three friends posing for a photo dressed up in character. Sheridan Smith wowed viewers in the gritty drama 
In court, both were both Karen and her accomplice Michael Donovan were found guilty of kidnapping, false imprisonment and perverting the course of justice and were sentenced to eight year's imprisonment. 
Karen was released on licence in April 2012. Like us on Facebook
